name: Swapnil Kusale
biography: Swapnil Kusale is an Indian rifle shooter who has made a name for himself in the sport. He secured one of India's earliest quotas for the 2024 Paris Olympics, finishing fourth at the 2022 World Championships in the 50m rifle 3P event. Kusale has overcome various challenges, including a chronic tonsils issue, to reach this point in his career. He is known for his dedication to improving his physical strength and fitness, which has in turn enhanced his shooting technique.
childhood: Swapnil Kusale was born in Pune, Maharashtra. He took up shooting at the Krida Prabodhini in Pune, where his career in the sport began in 2009 at the age of 14.
professional_career: Kusale's professional career has seen its ups and downs. He missed the Tokyo Games in 2021 but went on to win his first individual World Cup medal a year later. Kusale was part of the bronze-winning 50m rifle 3P team at the 2022 Cairo Worlds and the gold-winning team at the Asian Games, though he narrowly missed individual medals in both events. Despite coming close to two career-defining medals, Kusale experienced heartbreaking finishes, but he has learned from these experiences and is now focused on representing India at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
